newsitem.title: BELARUS: Belarus halts sugar refining, slams Russia pricing.
newsitem.headline: Belarus halts sugar refining, slams Russia pricing.

text.p: Belarus sugar refineries have stopped operating because Russian firms supplying raw sugar to the plants are not selling at levels established by the Economy Ministry, Agriculture Minister Vasily Leonov said on Thursday.
"The factories have stopped working -- Russian companies supplying raw sugar to us have refused to sell sugar on our market at prices agreed by the Economy Ministry," he told a news conference.
Belarus' four sugar plants refined around 200,000 tonnes of imported raw sugar -- both beet and cane -- a year.

"There are 30,000 tonnes of sugar stored in warehouses, which Russian companies will not sell below the cost of production, insisting instead on increasing prices from 14,000 to 20,000 roubles per kilogramme," Leonov said.
"By fixing prices for agricultural goods the state is carrying out a policy of lifting social tension in the capital at the expense of the peasants."
He said that sugar refining in Belarus would be fully privatised this year. One plant had already been privatised and the other three were preparing paperwork.
He said Belarus processed 100,000 tonnes of its own raws annually in addition to the 200,000 tonnes it imported.
